question.questionText: Why can duplicate packets be a problem in a network? Please state your answer in a single sentence.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: if the receiver is not capable of differentiating between valid and duplicated packets it may act on the same information twice.

studentAnswer.response: The network can be flooded by unnecessary packets.
Duplicate packets increases the traffic on a network, so for example collisions or congestion can occur.

Firstly, duplicates reduce the data rate, but more importantly, if not detected, duplicate packets can, e.g., trigger re-execution of transactions or actions in general. This can result in faulty behavior or can be used for malicious means.

First, duplicates take up unnecessary space within the whole network and leading to heavier congestion secondly, duplicates require some kind of knowledge (state) at the receiver to determine if it's actually a duplicate (e.g sequence number). Also, the identifier should be unique within multiple sessions to avoid discarding packages (false positives) that are no real duplicates.
They can cause unnecessary traffic and unwanted behavior which might be exploited by adversaries.
Without additional means, the receiver can not differentiate between correct data and duplicate data and would re-execute the transaction, which leads to waste of resources
A receiver dont knot how to handle duplicates within a connection because he cannot diffentiate between correct data and duplicates.
The duplicated packets reduce effective tool bandwidth, waste tool processing power, and consume tool storage capacity, reducing their effectiveness (The performance goes down ).
Because the receiver can't differentiate between correct and duplicated data and would interact with the data twice for instance transferring money in a bank a second time.
Empfänger kann nicht ohne Weiteres zwischen Duplikaten und echten Paketen unterscheiden.
There is a possiblity to get duplicates of a message, which can result in unwanted behavior and higher data rates.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is correct. The usage of term "higher data rate" is not clear.

studentAnswer.response: The Receiver cannot differentiate between correct data and arriving duplicated data. Operations might be re-executed. (f.21)
They create more traffic and reduce bandwith as well as available processing power
Duplicate Packets require Resources without transmitting unique information/data between nodes, which also increases the amount of collisions.
Duplicates may look like two separate commands/messages to the receiver.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is correct. The response can also state what will be the consequence in such a scenario.

studentAnswer.response: if the receiver is not capable of differentiating between valid and duplicated packets it may act on the same information twice.
Duplicates might be a problem because the receiver can not differentiate between the correct data and the duplicate without additional means.
A receiver cannot distinguish duplicate data and original data
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is correct. The response can also state what will be the consequence in such a scenario.

studentAnswer.response: If the receiver cannot differentiate between original and duplicate packages, it might execute instructions sent by the user multiple times.
Duplicates lead to pointless load, which leads to an inefficient network.
Duplicate packages lead to duplication of the intent of the package e.g. a transaction ment to be performed only once.
Duplicates are problematic in a sense that they can re-execute transactions which the client who sent the original data did not intend to do.
If there are many duplicates in the network, the performance may decrease (-> congestion) and problems might occur (bank example from the lecture).
Duplikate sind ein Problem, da der Empfänger diese als neue Daten interpretieren und somit doppelt darauf reagieren könnte. (Beispiel aus der VL, bei dem doppelt Geld von der Bank überwiesen wurde).
Receiver usually cannot differentiate between correct data and duplicates which may cause re-execution of the transaction
The receiver can't differentiate between the original message and the duplicate. If not handled correctly, it might reply to both the original message and the duplicate.
Duplicate packets require ressources without transmitting new data and can cause more collisions.

If duplicates occur in a network, the receiver of such packets cannot determine whether they are correct or duplicated data, in the worst case leading to multiple executions of actions which only should be executed once.

When the network is full of duplicates, the performance goes down and different malfunction can occur (example with the bank transfer in the lecture, which with many duplicates can then occur correspondingly often).
Duplicate data cannot be differentiated from correct data , and it would re-execute the transaction.
Without additional measures in a network duplicate packets can not be differentiated from the correct packets and therefore a transaction would be re-executed by the duplicates.
it is not clear to the receiver whether the duplicated message is the same message sent twice or just a copy of the first one, and should be ignored.
This can be a problem if the recipient of the duplicates has no way to distinguish between correct and duplicate data, such that late duplicates could be incorrectly considered as new data.
The receiver may not be able to detect duplicates which could cause double execution of actions or transactions leading to lower data rates (because delay non-duplicate packets) and faulty behaviour.

Duplicating in a network could lead to a mismatch transaction between sender and receiver which they can execute the request for many times, E.g. Transfers money for twice even though customer actually sent one request.
The receiver will not be able to differentiate (without additional information) between the correct and the duplicated data.
The network can be congested by large amounts of duplicate packets.
Flooding duplicates can cause a network congestion so that the network is not performant.
If duplicate packets are sent and the receiver cannot recognize that it is a duplicate and thinks it is a single network, the receiver reacts to both packets.
If you have too many duplicates the performance goes down and the network gets overloaded.

Network has varying transit times for packets, certain loss rate and storage capabilities, as well as packets can be manipulated, duplicated by flooding and resent by the original system after timeout.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The statement is not clear and specific about the problem caused in such scenario.

studentAnswer.response: The receiver cannot differentiate between the real and the duplicated data without additional measures, hence it could for example re-execute the transaction
There could be a delayed packet received with old content which would lead to misscommunication.
They may cause a receiver to execute a task after it has already been executed.
It cannot be determined why the duplicate occured and thus how to handle / further process it
A duplicate packet can cause an action to happen more than once, which is an undesirable action.

Firstly, duplicate packets might have a negative impact on handshake phase of some protocol(e.g.,duplicate packet can let server stop to wait reponse from client in 3-way handshake of TCP) .Besides, duplicate packets also cause re-execution.
Receiver might not be able to distinguish between a real and a duplicate packet.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is correct. The response can also state what will be the consequence in such a scenario.

studentAnswer.response: without additional means the receiver cannot differentiate between correct data and duplicated data.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is correct. The response can also state what will be the consequence in such a scenario.

studentAnswer.response: They can cause an action to happen twice since the receiver may not be able to distinguish between a packet that was sent twice and one packet that arrives twice.
Because they arrive at the receiver at an undesired time, causing unintended behavior.
Duplicate können zum Problem werden, weil zum Beispiel Befehle mehrmals ankommen und auch mehrmals ausgeführt werden.
Duplicate packets can be a problem because a receiver might process a packet more than once which could cause unwanted effects.
Duplicate packets arriving at receiver may cause a transaction to be completed multiple times.
Duplicate Packets can lead to congestion.
the duplicate packets reduce effective tool bandwidth, waste tool processing power and consume tool storage capacity.

Duplicate packets contain the same infomartion as the "original" packet, therefore the receiver gets the information/instructions within the packet a second time and has to validate if he has already consumed/executed them.
It s difficult for the receiver to differentiate between correct data and duplicated data, so he may threat the duplicated data also as correct data and may act on the same information twice.
Dpulicate packets can lead to congestion.

If the receiver can't detect that a certain packet is a duplicate of one that arrived before, it might be processed independently causing maybe an action to be executed twice (for example a bank transaction).
Duplicates increase the traffic, they slow down the network.

They put additional load on the underlying network and they have to be identified as duplicates to prevent reacting again on the packet, which includes unnecessary processing (worst case: replay attack) or more packets to be sent again as a reply.
Without additional safeguards duplicate packets could trigger an action (i.e. Bank Transfer) a second time.
Duplicate packages can lead to congestion by overflowing buffers of intermediate systems if the amount of duplicates is too high and thus latency increased.
Duplicate packets cause bandwidth waste in a network, and may disrupt the sequence of "normal" packets or even be received as new.
Duplicates cannot be distinguished from real packets at the receiving side and can lead to reexecutions of transactions (e.g. connection establishments, bank transfer).
They steal available bandwith and once the first of the duplicate packets arrives at it's destination all others are obsolete.
Without additional means the receiver cannot differentiate between correct data and duplicated data.

Duplicate packets - when not detected properly - can cause unexpected behaviour in the systems participating in the network like e.g. executing a certain action on a server multiple times although it was only meant to be executed once.

Duplicates can be transmitted at a later, undesirable time to the receiver. E.g. as long as the receiver cannot differentiate between an original and duplicate packet, transactions could be re-executed by receiving a duplicate (e.g. money transfer).

The network protocol needs a method to prevent duplicate packets otherwise a loop could be formed where the duplicate packet is forwarded indefinitely. An IS would need to keep track of all packets it has seen recently which is not feasible.
Because the large number of duplicate packets consume the network bandwidth as well as require more process power.
Duplicated packed lead to more traffic in the network which can end in a congestion.
The duplicate packets reduce effective tool bandwidth, waste tool processing power, and consume tool storage capacity, reducing their effectiveness.
Duplicate packets within a connection can lead to actions being executed twice instead of just once (e.g. money transfer)
Duplicate packets reduce performance of a network, since the receiver cannot tell the difference between the original and duplicate packets, transactions are executed twice.
The duplicate packets reduce effective tool bandwidth, waste tool processing power, and consume tool storage capacity, reducing their effectiveness.
Duplicates can lead to network congestion.

Duplicate packages are handed over to the receiver too late at an undesired time, so that the receiver can't handle it or handles it twice, which for example can result in a loss if for example money is booked twice.
Duplicating packets in a network can waste tool processing power, reduce effective tool bandwidth, consume tool storage capacity, reduce the effectiveness and obviously cause misunderstandings.
Because the receiver cannot differentiate between correct data and duplicated data which results often in unintended packet procession (in addition or instead of the correct data).
They congest the network by creating unnecessary traffic.

Network has varying transit times for packets, certain loss rate and storage capabilities, as well as packets can be manipulated, duplicated by flooding and resent by the original system after timeout.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is not precise about the problem or consequences caused when duplicates are present.

studentAnswer.response: The receiver cannot differentiate between correct data and duplicated data and one also might be faced with network congestion due to too many duplicate packets.
Too much duplicate pacekets will reduce performance of network such as congestion.
Apart from filling the network with unnecessary data, as it was said in the lecture, they can also cause problems to the applications to which they are going to be sent.
The performance of the network goes down with too many duplicate packets and we need to find ways to differentiate between correct date and duplicate date.
The performance of the network goes down with too many duplicate packets and we need to find ways to differentiate between correct date and duplicate date.
Der Empfänger kann nicht zwischen korrekten und duplizierten Daten unterscheiden.
studentAnswer.response_feedback: The response is correct. The response can also state what will be the consequence in such a scenario.

studentAnswer.response: The receiver can not differentiate between correct packets and duplicate ones, which may lead to re-execute the transaction.
The network will be congested by unnecessary traffic resulting in overhead.
The Problem will occur at the receivers end which cannot differentiate between the correct and the duplicated data without given any additional information
The performance goes down and without additional means the receiver cannot differentiate between correct data and duplicated data
Because they will waste the bandwidth.
because the receiver can not differentiate between correct and duplicate data and would interact with the data twice for instance transferring money in a bank a second time
